item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, November 8, 2024 at 3:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Multiple new macOS sandbox escape vulnerabilities (130 points | 27 comments)
2. Stabilizing the Obra Dinn 1-bit dithering process (2017) (98 points | 19 comments)
3. Show HN: Asterogue, my sci-fi roguelike, is now playable on the web (78 points | 31 comments)
4. LoRA vs. Full Fine-Tuning: An Illusion of Equivalence (90 points | 18 comments)
5. The evolution of nepotism in academia, 1088-1800 (29 points | 17 comments)
6. Perceptually lossless (talking head) video compression at 22kbit/s (116 points | 61 comments)
7. Why I love Rust for tokenising and parsing (228 points | 136 comments)
8. Λ-2D: An Exploration of Drawing as Programming Language (42 points | 20 comments)
9. The 'Invisibility Cloak' – Slash-Proc Magic (20 points | discuss)
10. Elwood Edwards, Voice of AOL's 'You've Got Mail ' Alert, Dies at 74 (20 points | 2 comments)
11. How is the SSD installed – M4 Mac Mini (2024) (61 points | 45 comments)
12. Fedora KDE Desktop Spin Promoted to Same Tier as Gnome-Based Fedora Workstation (17 points | 8 comments)
13. Claude Shannon: Mathematician, Engineer, Genius and Juggler? (63 points | 23 comments)
14. The Charms of Catastrophe (1978) (7 points | 2 comments)
15. Practical Radio Circuits (2003) [pdf] (101 points | 21 comments)
16. Launch HN: Codebuff (YC F24) – CLI tool that writes code for you (261 points | 217 comments)
17. Using Ghidra and Python to reverse engineer Ecco the Dolphin (422 points | 118 comments)
18. Roaring Bitmap Compression (42 points | 4 comments)
19. Functional ultrasound through the skull (223 points | 73 comments)
20. Mushroom Color Atlas (270 points | 28 comments)
21. AI for real-time fusion plasma behavior prediction and manipulation (261 points | 130 comments)
22. Show HN: Draw.Audio – A musical sketchpad using the Web Audio API (171 points | 56 comments)
23. Sustainable Web Interest Group Is Formed (181 points | 91 comments)
24. Intentrace: Strace for Everyone (37 points | 7 comments)
25. Understanding privacy risk with k-anonymity and l-diversity (46 points | 4 comments)
26. I'm not mutable, I'm partially instantiated (210 points | 64 comments)
27. QNX is now free for anything non-commercial, plus there's an RPi image (615 points | 295 comments)
28. Methodology is bullshit: principles for product velocity (193 points | 107 comments)
29. Hyperlight: Virtual machine-based security for functions at scale (137 points | 21 comments)
30. Linux Syscall Support (192 points | 108 comments)
